Isaac ChanLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 21 Feb 2019I agree with the rest that the PE ratio for HDL is really very high. There's certainly a lot of hype recently by the markets and by consumers but I'm not sure if this can be sustained in the future. Interestingly, despite a lot of talk that the PE ratio of HDL was so high, share prices have gone up since the IPO last year. I think a lot of the hype can be attributed to their rapid growth plans in the near future, but as to whether these plans can materialise and push the hype into the Western Countries is quite uncertain. Maintaining quality and consistency for F&B can be quite challenging. In fact, HDL did have some quality control issues before at various outlets. Clark Quay had an outlet that was suspended for 2 weeks. (https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/clarke-quay-branch-of-chinese-hotpot-chain-suspended-for-unsanitary-food-handling)Another way to look at this is to compare the P/E to EPS growth (PEG) with other comparables.
